p: Total protein in the tissue homogenates and serum was measured by Weichselbaum (1946) using commercially available kits (Randox laboratories, UK). One milliliter of Reagent R1 made up of sodium hydroxide (100 mM), Na–K-tartrate (18 mM), potassium iodide (15 mM) and cupric sulphate (6 mM) was mixed with 0.02 mL of the homogenates and incubated at 25 °C. Absorbance of the mixture was measured at 546 nm.
